message.content:
cs.IT, cs.ITP, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.MM

Reasoning: The paper deals with source coding and channel coding, which are both topics in information theory (cs.IT). The use of Markov sources and channels with conditional Markovian additive noise suggests that the paper may also fall under the sub-categories of information theory and probability (cs.ITP) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the efficient computability of the bounds, which could fall under the sub-category of signal processing (cs.SI). Finally, the introduction of information measures for transition matrices suggests that the paper may also fall under the sub-category of multimedia (cs.MM).
